text: A few instructions before we start. What's going to happen here is I'm going to ask you questions and you're going to answer. The court reporter is taking it down. It's important not to talk over each other.  It makes it difficult for the court reporter to take the question down.  Make sure you understand my question before you answer it.  If you don't, I'm glad to repeat it.  I don't want you to give an inaccurate answer. You can't answer uh-uh or uh-huh.  You have to say yes or no because the court reporter can't take that down, and we wouldn't know what you meant by it necessarily. Is there any reason today why you can't give a deposition? Are you on any kind of medication or disability or anything?

text: What I remember is this; I was coming down and the car cut us off, cut me off.  It was a red truck in front of me.  I went to the far-right lane.  That car went this way, this way and shot.  I said, dang, he almost got me. I looked back into the middle lane. The gold car and a couple other cars are behind me.  I drive with my left hand.  I'm riding down.  I click.  I go over.  No one is there, but I see cars behind me, the gold car and everything. Like I said, we're going about 35, 40, because the day was like today and kind of drizzling.  I started drifting very slow over, and I heard a roar.  I turned around, and we both just kind of breezed over to the side.

When I'm coming down back, I stay to the far right because it's got the other lane over there, too.

text: When you go there, you'll see both sides.  That was the more safe.  At that point where we were at, that was the more safer side if you were trying to get off the road.  If I can remember, that's where we was.  I think that's where we was, to the right.

text: Just one more for the record.  If you could, just break it down a little bit how the accident occurred. About a minute before the accident, you were traveling in the middle lane of Roosevelt Boulevard?

text: What color was that car?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: A dark-colored car.  There was a white car, his car, other cars behind me.  I even asked him.  I said did you see what just happened.  He told me yes. I cut over to the right lane.  There was a red truck.  I cut back over to the middle lane.  The red truck was gone.  We drove about a block.  Everything was clear. I drive with my left hand.  I clicked my turn signal.  I looked.  I went slowly over. That's when I heard the engine, and that's when we both went over.  I could tell you that 20 years from now, same thing.

text: No.  Again, that happened before I was in the middle.  That happened before the accident, way before the accident. Again, I jumped in the middle lane. We drove about a block.  It was about a good distance.  The red truck was gone and the black car that shot past everybody, the dark-colored car. That's, again, when I started proceeding over to the left lane.  I heard the boom, boom, boom, and I turned over.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there a reason that you proceed into the left lane?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: Again, that's the lane I like to drive in.  I do 76.  I do that route almost every day.  If I'm going back the other way, I'll be on the other far-right lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When was the first time that you saw the vehicle that you were involved in an accident with?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: First time I saw it?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes, prior to impact.
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: Again, as that car cut in front of me, I seen a white car behind me.  I seen that car and other cars.  The only reason I seen that car was because that car was directly behind me.  When I went to go this way, that's when I felt that car coming up behind me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You first saw the car you were involved in the accident with when you were in the middle lane?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: When I was coming down --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In which lane?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: In the middle lane.  The car cut me off.  I jumped into the right lane.  When that car got past that, it was a red truck in front of me.  I went back to the middle lane. The red truck went about a block. Everybody was behind me.  Everything to the right and left of me was clear.  My antennas was up.  Clicked my turn signal, and that's when I proceeded slowly.  That's what happened.  I said, did you see that car, what happened?  He told me yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You asked him, meaning Mr. Pham?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you estimate how many car lengths away the car that you were involved in the accident was when you saw them?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: Three to four car lengths.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I think that should be all for me.
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: - - - EXAMINATION
You indicated you looked into your mirror. This was before you started to turn?
speaker: MR. KELLY

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you also turn your head at any point to look?
speaker: MR. KELLY

text: No?  Where?  For what?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You didn't turn your head to the left in addition?
speaker: MR. KELLY

text: Click, click, and my eyes went from here to there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You didn't --
speaker: MR. KELLY

text: No.  No reason to do that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you received any medical treatment as a result of the accident?
speaker: MR. KELLY

text: Yes.  Like I said, I left there and went down to somewhere on 9th in south Philly.  I went there about twice.  That was it.  The lawyer called me about this case.  I said I really wasn't hurt at all.  I didn't go back.  He said, well, I'm dropping you.  I said okay.  I didn't think nothing of it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: - - - EXAMINATION
Was it physical therapy?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You went there about two times, you said?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any other medical treatment in relation to this accident besides the south Philly place you went to two times?
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That is all for me.
speaker: MS. KATHOPOULIS

text: (Whereupon, the deposition concluded at 12:29 p.m.)

- - - C E R T I F I C A T E I hereby certify that the proceedings, evidence and objections noted are contained fully and accurately in the notes taken by me on this hearing of the above-captioned case on August 26, 2019, and that this is a correct transcription of same.
